title: Towards Personalized Cold-Start Recommendation with Prompts. (arXiv:2306.17256v1 [cs.IR])
abstract: Recommender systems play a crucial role in helping users discover information that aligns with their interests based on their past behaviors. However, developing personalized recommendation systems becomes challenging when historical records of user-item interactions are unavailable, leading to what is known as the system cold-start recommendation problem. This issue is particularly prominent in start-up businesses or platforms with insufficient user engagement history. Previous studies focus on user or item cold-start scenarios, where systems could make recommendations for new users or items but are still trained with historical user-item interactions in the same domain, which cannot solve our problem. To bridge the gap, our research introduces an innovative and effective approach, capitalizing on the capabilities of pre-trained language models. translated_title: 以提示为基础的个性化冷启动推荐的研究
translated_abstract: 推荐系统在根据用户过去的行为帮助用户发现与其兴趣相符的信息方面发挥着关键作用。然而，当用户和物品之间的历史交互记录不可用时，开发个性化推荐系统变得具有挑战性，这就是所谓的系统冷启动推荐问题。此问题在创业企业或用户参与历史不足的平台中尤为突出。以往的研究集中在用户或物品的冷启动场景，其中系统仍然通过在同一领域中的历史用户和物品交互进行训练来为新用户或物品提供推荐，而无法解决我们的问题。为了弥合这一鸿沟，我们的研究引入了一种创新且有效的方法，利用预训练语言模型的能力。我们将推荐过程转化为自然语言情感分析，其中包含用户资料和物品属性的信息。
tldr: 本研究旨在解决个性化冷启动推荐问题，通过利用预训练语言模型的能力，将推荐过程转化为自然语言情感分析，提供适用于创业企业和用户参与历史不足的平台的个性化推荐。
en_tdlr: This research aims to address the issue of personalized cold-start recommendation by leveraging the capabilities of pre-trained language models. By transforming the recommendation process into sentiment analysis of natural languages containing user profiles and item attributes, it provides personalized recommendations suitable for start-up businesses and platforms with insufficient user engagement history.
